result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chattman J Jordan

records.addlTxt: Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List- State of Wisconsin
order signed on 10/21/22; Atty Mark Leonard appointed on 11/4/22-down payment made
A.M. contacted DE at 2:17 PM re: GRANTED Petition for Appointment of Counsel (PAPERWORK ROUTED TO COLLECTIONS)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Appeal of Eligibility Determination for Appoint of Counsel
Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 11:45 am.

1:50 PM Hearing held via Zoom due to Judge illness- parties agree to proceed. Defendant Chattman J Jordan in court.  Attorney Cecilia E DeMarco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant filed Waiver of Right to Attorney. Defendant states he did not have enough time to submit paystub for CDP application but could do it this week. CT: DE to complete CDP process. File review set for 10/28 to check status of appointment. Trial dates taken off calendar. 

Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Defendant here today at Collections window to apply for county appointed attorney - to return with completed Petition for Counsel, bring along SPD Financial Eligibility Worksheet and provide most recent paystub.
Letter from SPD to Clerk re: no atty assigned
Pre-trial conference on October 17, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

03:14 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kathleen Chung.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
